nodes.bodyText: This should have a  @PreAuthorize("hasAuthority('AUTHENTICATED')") to verify that only logged in users can access this endpoint.  If you add this annotation, you can remove the check below for a currentUser, as it's no longer necessary.
Again, this should have @PreAuthorize("hasAuthority('AUTHENTICATED')"), and you should remove the check for a currentUser as it's no longer needed

Both an incorrect item and no claim tasks for the items result in a 404, the incorrect item should most likely be a 429
Same applies for the other searches below

@benbosman : A 429 is "Too Many Requests".  I don't think that's the error code we'd want here.  Is there a reason why 404 isn't sufficient?  I'll look at other search endpoints to see what they return in this scenario.

@benbosman : We are returning 404s on (at least some) other endpoints of this type.  For example

/api/config/workflowdefinitions/search/findByCollection?uuid=[invalidCollection] : https://github.com/DSpace/DSpace/blob/main/dspace-server-webapp/src/test/java/org/dspace/app/rest/WorkflowDefinitionRestRepositoryIT.java#L256
/api/eperson/registration/search/findByToken?token=[invalidToken]: https://github.com/DSpace/DSpace/blob/main/dspace-server-webapp/src/test/java/org/dspace/app/rest/RegistrationRestRepositoryIT.java#L94

In my opinion, a 404 is sufficient here, unless I'm missing your point.

Sorry, my mistake.
I meant 422, in line with https://github.com/DSpace/Rest7Contract/blob/main/vocabularies.md#get-controlled-vocabulary-by-metadata-and-collection

Thanks for clarifying.  I'm OK with switching this to 422... I can see how that might give more information to the client. A 404 also is returned if the endpoint is "Not Found", so in this scenario I can understand that a 404 might be misleading -- the request is valid, but the UUID param is not.
@abollini : Do you have a strong opinion here?  I can see both sides, and it seems like we've been inconsistent on whether to return 422 or 404 in this scenario.

thanks @benbosman @tdonohue to note that. 404 is not appropriate because the endpoint exists, it is just a matter of the result that must be returned or the parameters that have been provided.
There are four possible scenario here

the item UUID is missing, this should lead to a 400 error as it is a mandatory parameter
the parameter for the item UUID is invalid (it is a string, an integer, etc.) it should be treated as the previous case 400
the item is not found, this should return 422
the item exists but there are no claimed tasks for it, this should return an empty page with a 200 (as there is at least the pagination information in the json, if it was a single element search 204 would be used)

we have already had a detailed discussion around both aspects 404 vs 400 vs 422 and about the 200/204 for empty search but I was able to find previous references only for the first see
https://jira.lyrasis.org/browse/DS-4428
DSpace/RestContract#102
This also mean that the two enpoints noted by @tdonohue that currently return 404 are wrong and should be fixed

Thanks @abollini I've read through your 4 scenarios, and I agree with your proposed error codes for this endpoint
Regarding the two endpoints noted by @tdonohue :

https://github.com/DSpace/Rest7Contract/blob/main/epersonregistrations.md#search-eperson-registration doesn't return a list, and I'd assume it will return a 400 for a missing token and a 404 for a non-existing token
https://github.com/DSpace/Rest7Contract/blob/main/workflowdefinitions.md#findbycollection doesn't specify any details, but https://github.com/DSpace/DSpace/blob/main/dspace-server-webapp/src/main/java/org/dspace/app/rest/repository/WorkflowDefinitionRestRepository.java#L76 seems to also state it doesn't return a list. So this would imply:

the collection UUID is missing, this should lead to a 400 error as it is a mandatory parameter
the parameter for the collection UUID is invalid (it is a string, an integer, etc.) it should be treated as the previous case 400
the collection is not found, this should return 422
the collection exists but there is no workflow definition for it (if that's even possible), this should return a 404 since it's not a list

@benbosman when a single result is returned by a search method, null is translated to 204 No Content. This is already supported by our RestResourceController, see https://github.com/DSpace/DSpace/blob/main/dspace-server-webapp/src/main/java/org/dspace/app/rest/RestResourceController.java#L1014
I have also created #3093 to track the discussion about the other two endpoints
Small typing error
Shouldn't this be a 429?

It seems there are no tests for:

searching with a UUID not in the workflow (an archived item)
searching with a UUID in the workflow, without pooled tasks

This seems to be missing for the other search methods as well
